definition: near/approaching/to depend on/(slang) to have an intimate relationship with sb/Taiwan pr. [pang2], [bang1], [bang4]
7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)

sentences.english: I feel very hungry before lunchtime.
sentences.chinese: 傍午，我就感覺飢腸轆轆了。

definition: the sun sets in the west (idiom)
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
to thin out gradually/to become fainter and fainter
the sun sets over western hills (idiom); the day approaches its end/fig. time of decline/the end of an era/Sic transit gloria mundi
deep at night and all is quiet (idiom)
time/period during the day/one of the 12 two-hour periods enumerated by the earthly branches 地支
